title: "Taken The Pants Of The Aussies": World Cup-Winner's Funny Praise For Rishabh Pant - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Taken The Pants Of The Aussies": World Cup-Winner's Funny Praise For Rishabh Pant

Published on: January 4, 2025 | Source: NDTV

During the fifth Test against Australia, Rishabh Pant scored a remarkable 61 runs off just 33 balls, leading to humorous praise from former World Cup-winner Krishnamachari Srikkanth.

  • Pant scored the fastest fifty by a visiting batter on Australian soil.
  • He hit six fours and four sixes, showcasing his aggressive batting style.
  • Srikkanth tweeted: "What a knock by Pant! He's just taken the pants off the Aussies!"
  • Pant's rapid fifty came off just 29 balls, outperforming notable historical records.
  • His innings contributed to a partnership with Ravindra Jadeja that helped India surpass 100 runs.
“What a knock by pant! He's just taken the pants of the Aussies! #INDvsAUS” — Kris Srikkanth (@KrisSrikkanth) January 4, 2025

Pant's rapid scoring came at a crucial time as he joined the team batting under pressure, further solidifying his status as one of India’s top batsmen in Test cricket.
newTitle: Krishnamachari Srikkanth's Humorous Praise for Rishabh Pant's Performance

title: With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots - The Indian Express
summary:
Virat Kohli Takes Charge in Jasprit Bumrah's Absence During Match

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Indian Express

In a crucial match, Virat Kohli stepped up significantly after Jasprit Bumrah had to leave the field due to back spasms. His leadership was prominent as he actively engaged in fielding strategies and encouraged his teammates.

  • Kohli's day started with a minor lapse in fielding positions but quickly took charge of the game.
  • In Bumrah's absence, Kohli was very animated and involved, making adjustments and supporting bowlers.
  • He communicated effectively with both bowlers and fielders, helping them settle and perform.
  • His energy was evident as he celebrated milestones with teammates during the match.
  • After batting, Kohli faced disappointment, being dismissed by a delivery reminiscent of his earlier wicket.
“Let them earn it. Let them play some hard-fought cricket for the next few years or whatever it is. Let them earn it,” - Rohit Sharma on captaincy potential within the team.

Kohli's performance, both in the field and with the bat, showcased his experience and leadership, especially when the team faced challenges.
newTitle: Virat Kohli Takes Charge in Jasprit Bumrah's Absence During Match

title: 'Not His Battle To Fight': Ricky Ponting On Sam Konstas' Heated Exchange With Jasprit Bumrah - News18
summary:
Ricky Ponting Comments on Sam Konstas' Interjection in Bumrah-Khawaja Clash

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 21:36 IST

Former Australia skipper Ricky Ponting criticized Sam Konstas for involving himself in a verbal exchange between Jasprit Bumrah and Usman Khawaja during the Sydney Test. Ponting emphasized that it was unnecessary for Konstas to intervene in the matter.

  • Ponting condemned Konstas' actions, stating it was not his place to step in.
  • He hoped for a discussion in the Australian dressing room regarding the incident.
  • Ponting advised against upsetting Bumrah, who has been impactful in the series.
  • He expressed disdain for time-wasting tactics in cricket, suggesting it can backfire.
  • Australia suffered as Bumrah dismissed Khawaja on the last delivery of Day 1.
“I didn’t like Konstas getting involved. That was not his battle to fight.” - Ricky Ponting

The incident highlights the importance of senior players managing their disputes without unnecessary interference from younger players.
newTitle: Ricky Ponting Comments on Sam Konstas' Interjection in Bumrah-Khawaja Clash

title: "Cows Could Have...": Sunil Gavaskar Slams SCG Pitch As 15 Wickets Fall On Day 2 Of 5th Test - NDTV Sports
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Critiques SCG Pitch as 15 Wickets Fall in Fifth Test

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

The ongoing fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground has seen a total of 15 wickets tumble on the second day, prompting legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar to voice his concerns about the pitch conditions.

  • After 11 wickets fell on day one, day two resulted in another 15 wickets.
  • India bowled out Australia for 181, taking a four-run first-innings lead.
  • Gavaskar suggests that the pitch conditions would be criticized if they occurred in India.
  • Scott Boland excelled, taking 4 wickets for 42 runs after having taken 4 for 31 on day one.
  • Australia's Alex Carey praised Boland's performance and strategy.
“If 15 wickets fell (on one day) in India, all hell would have broken loose.” - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, this Test match is raising questions about ideal playing conditions and the nature of pitches used in cricket.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Critiques SCG Pitch as 15 Wickets Fall in Fifth Test

title: Workload may've affected Jasprit Bumrah but he's not this BGT's top workhorse - The Times of India
summary:
Workload may've affected Jasprit Bumrah but he's not this BGT's top workhorse

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's ace bowler, Jasprit Bumrah, has garnered attention not just for his performances but also for his workload amid concerns over a potential back spasm. As the Border-Gavaskar Trophy approaches its conclusion, Bumrah's fitness for the crucial matches remains uncertain.

  • Bumrah has taken 31 wickets in just five Tests of the series.
  • Despite his efforts, he is not in the top two for overs bowled this series.
  • Australia's Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc have bowled more deliveries than Bumrah.
  • In batting contributions, Bumrah has scored 42 runs compared to Cummins' 159 and Starc's 97.
“It remains unclear whether he will take the field tomorrow.”

As discussions swirl around his performance and fitness, the cricketing world anxiously awaits Bumrah's next steps as India strives for victory in the series.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah's Workload Scrutinized Ahead of Series Finale

Rohit Sharma's future in Test cricket remains uncertain as he took a self-imposed break from the playing XI. During an interview, he addressed retirement speculations, asserting he is not going anywhere yet.

title: WTC Final On Line, Injured Jasprit Bumrah To Bat But Report Says Bowling Will Be... - NDTV Sports
Navjot Singh Sidhu backs Rohit Sharma, slams Indian Team management: ‘Removing him during series sends wrong signals’ - Mint
summary:
Navjot Singh Sidhu backs Rohit Sharma, slams Indian Team management: ‘Removing him during series sends wrong signals’

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Press Trust of India

Former Indian cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu has expressed his support for Indian skipper Rohit Sharma regarding his decision to opt out of the final Test against Australia, stressing that such decisions should not be made during a series.

  • Sidhu criticized the management for sending the wrong signals by removing Sharma during the series.
  • He emphasized that Rohit deserves respect and faith, even amidst a dip in form, due to his past achievements.
  • Rohit, addressing the controversy, stated the decision to sit out was challenging for him but prioritized the team's needs.
“Such decisions have to be taken before or after a series. Horses cannot be changed midstream.” — Navjot Singh Sidhu

Rohit reflected on his commitment to the team and the importance of collective needs over individual desires.
newTitle: Navjot Singh Sidhu supports Rohit Sharma's decision amidst team management controversy.

title: 'If 15 wickets fell in a day in India...': Gavaskar fires savage 'we are not moaners' verbal volley at AUS, ENG greats - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar fires back at Australia and England greats

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Sunil Gavaskar made critical remarks regarding the reaction of Australian and English cricketers to the performance on a challenging Sydney Test pitch, highlighting a disparity in how similar situations are perceived in India.

  • 15 wickets fell on Day 2 of the fifth Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test.
  • Gavaskar stated that any significant wicket loss in India would lead to widespread criticism of pitch conditions.
  • India's second innings saw Rishabh Pant contributing a quick half-century.
  • Gavaskar emphasized that Indian players do not complain about pitch conditions compared to their foreign counterparts.
  • The Sydney pitch was criticized for lacking ideal conditions for Test cricket.
"You'll never find us complaining. But 15 wickets in a day in India, man, there would be hell."

In conclusion, Gavaskar argues for a more balanced view on pitch conditions and criticizes double standards in cricketing discourse.
newTitle: Gavaskar Critiques Australia and England Over Test Match Conditions

India pacer Prasidh Krishna provided an update about Jasprit Bumrah, who left the field due to a back spasm during the fifth Test at SCG. Bumrah's absence raised concerns but was later alleviated ahead of Australia's innings.

  • Bumrah left the field after bowling just one over.

title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2: IND crumble again, finish 141/6 at stumps, take 145-run lead - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar remained unbeaten at stumps, but India crumbled under pressure, finishing the day at 141/6, leading by 145 runs after Australia was dismissed for 181.

  • Rishabh Pant scored a quickfire half-century off 29 balls before being dismissed by Pat Cummins.
  • India struggled throughout the innings with several key players, including Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill, losing their wickets early.
  • Jasprit Bumrah returned to the ground after concerns over his injury, providing a boost to the team.
  • Scott Boland was a standout performer for Australia, taking crucial wickets, including that of Kohli and Gill.
  • India's bowlers, led by Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj, performed well, helping dismiss Australia for 181.
“If Australia don't win in Sydney, they will continue to suffer from a drought of a decade-plus without getting their hands on the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.”

The match remains highly competitive as both teams have significant stakes in the outcome, with India's World Test Championship hopes on the line and Australia seeking redemption in the series.
newTitle: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2: IND crumble again, finish 141/6 at stumps, take 145-run lead

summary:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2: IND 141/6 vs AUS at Stumps in Sydney

Date: January 5, 2025   Source: Indian Express

At the end of Day 2 in the final Test in Sydney, India stands at 141/6, leading Australia by 145 runs. Scott Boland took four wickets to help restrict India, who had seen Rishabh Pant score a quick 61 earlier in the innings.

  • Scott Boland scalped four wickets, bringing India to 141/6 at stumps.
  • India's first innings totaled 185 runs, with Australia replying with 181 runs.
  • Washington Sundar and Ravindra Jadeja are both unbeaten at the day's end.
  • This match is critical in deciding the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
“After winning the first Test in Perth, India has lost the second one in Adelaide. The result of the Sydney Test will decide who will take the Border Gavaskar Trophy.”

title: Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable' - The Times of India
summary:
Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable'

Published on: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's Rishabh Pant delivered a stunning performance during the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, scoring a rapid 61 runs off 33 balls, which has drawn praise from cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar.

  • Pant scored 61 runs in just 33 balls at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
  • His 29-ball fifty is the second-fastest for India in Test cricket.
  • He became the fastest visiting batter to reach a Test fifty on Australian soil.
  • Sachin Tendulkar praised Pant's innings as 'truly remarkable' on social media.
  • Pant's innings featured six fours and four sixes, showcasing his explosive batting style.
  • Despite Pant's effort, India ended the day at a precarious 141/6 in the match.

On a wicket where the majority of the batters have batted at a SR of 50 or less, @RishabhPant17's knock with a SR of 184 is truly remarkable. He has rattled Australia from ball one. It is always entertaining to watch him bat. What an impactful innings!

Pant's innings proves his capability to significantly impact crucial matches, and he continues to be a key player for India.
newTitle: Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable'
